snippets.title: Value-at-Risk (VaR)
snippets.body: VaR is a statistical measure that estimates the maximum loss over a target horizon with a given confidence level. For example, VaR(99%) = 10% suggests that with 99% confidence annual loss won't exceed 10%.

snippets.title: Fees Explained
snippets.body: Management fees are charged as a percentage of assets under management and are shown in basis points (bps). Lower fees mean more of your returns remain invested.
